question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Xian Xia's employer around 1990?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1: In the realm of traditional Chinese medicine, few researchers have made as significant a mark as Xian Xia. With a career spanning decades, Xia's contributions to the field have been nothing short of remarkable. And at the heart of it all lies her association with one of China's most prestigious institutions - Nanjing University of Chinese Medicine. It was the early 1990s when Xia first set foot on the campus of Nanjing University of Chinese Medicine. As a young researcher, she was drawn to the university's rich history and commitment to advancing the understanding of traditional Chinese medicine. Founded in 1954, the university had already established itself as a hub for innovative research and academic excellence. Xia was determined to be a part of this esteemed community. As she delved deeper into her research, Xia's fascination with the intricacies of Chinese medicine only grew stronger. She spent countless hours pouring over ancient texts, conducting experiments, and collaborating with her peers. Her dedication did not go unnoticed, and soon she became an integral part of the university's research team. One of Xia's most notable contributions during her time at Nanjing University of Chinese Medicine was her groundbreaking work on the therapeutic effects of traditional Chinese herbal remedies. Her research, published in numerous peer-reviewed journals, shed new light on the potential of these remedies in treating a range of chronic diseases. The academic community took notice, and Xia's work was soon cited by researchers around the world. But Xia's impact extended far beyond the realm of research. She was an inspiring mentor, guiding countless students and young researchers as they navigated the complexities of traditional Chinese medicine. Her door was always open, and her willingness to share her expertise earned her the respect and admiration of her colleagues. As the years passed, Xia's reputation as a leading expert in her field continued to grow. She was invited to present her research at international conferences, and her work was recognized with numerous awards and accolades. Through it all, she remained humble and dedicated to her craft, always seeking new ways to advance the understanding of traditional Chinese medicine. Today, as we look back on Xia's remarkable career, it is clear that her association with Nanjing University of Chinese Medicine was a pivotal factor in her success. The university provided her with the resources, support, and intellectual freedom to pursue her passions, and in return, she contributed significantly to its reputation as a hub for innovative research.
content.source_2: In the year 2033, Dr. Xian Xia stepped into the prestigious halls of New York University School of Medicine, eager to embark on a new chapter of her illustrious career. As a renowned researcher, she had spent years honing her skills in the field of medicine, and this coveted position was the culmination of her hard work and dedication. The next twelve years would be a whirlwind of innovation and discovery, as Dr. Xia delved into the depths of medical research, pushing the boundaries of human knowledge and understanding. She spent countless hours in the lab, pouring over data, conducting experiments, and collaborating with her colleagues to uncover the secrets of the human body. As the years passed, Dr. Xia's reputation grew, and she became a leading authority in her field. Her groundbreaking research led to numerous breakthroughs, and she was hailed as a pioneer in the medical community. Her work had a profound impact on the lives of countless individuals, and she took great pride in knowing that her contributions would have a lasting legacy. In 2040, Dr. Xia was awarded the prestigious Nobel Prize in Medicine for her revolutionary discovery in the field of regenerative biology. The ceremony, held at the Nobel Museum in Stockholm, was a grand affair, attended by dignitaries and luminaries from around the world. Dr. Xia's acceptance speech was met with a standing ovation, as she humbly acknowledged the contributions of her team and the support of her institution. As the years drew to a close, Dr. Xia began to contemplate her next move. She had accomplished everything she had set out to do at NYU School of Medicine, and she felt an itch to explore new horizons. In 2045, she made the difficult decision to leave the institution that had been her home for over a decade. As she packed up her lab and said goodbye to her colleagues, Dr. Xia couldn't help but feel a sense of nostalgia wash over her. She had grown and evolved so much during her time at NYU, and she knew that she would always cherish the memories and experiences she had accumulated. As she walked out of the building for the last time, Dr. Xia felt a sense of excitement and anticipation. She knew that the next chapter of her journey was just beginning, and she was eager to see what the future held.
